posts.post_content:
BEST CARD EVER
  
Sure it doesn't win games by itself but the speed it adds is priceless and will win you many games I have a friend who get turn 4 wins with no mana accel, I know its not very impressive, but the point is with this he could literally win on his first turn, his combo only needs the mana not the turns, and the rest of his cards are extended.
  
Whoever didn't give this a 5 is a retard this is an autoinclude on any vintage because when you draw it, it is awesome.
  
(I know that combo isn't very impressive and there are lots like it.)

posts.post_content: I agree with Syvanis, what sets Black Lotus above possibly every other card is that it can go in, and benefit, almost every deck. You wouldn't play [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) in white weenie, but you'd play Black Lotus. You wouldn't play [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle) in monoblue control, but you'd play Black Lotus. You wouldn't play [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) in Red Deck Wins, but... you see where I'm going with this?

Posted By: infernox10 (3/4/2011 9:24:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Saying that [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) is better than [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) is like saying candy is better than money.
  
   
The power 9 are the power 9 for a reason. That reason being that no matter what your combo, no matter what card you want to get to win these will help you.
  
   
[Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) is a great card, don't get me wrong. But it is not as universally awesome as the power 9. [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) is the king of them all because it goes in any deck as said above. Of course if you have a [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) you might load up whatever mono-deck you have with dual lands just so you can slap it in there anyway, but that's a different discussion...
  
   
The only reasonable arguement anyone could make would be [Demonic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Tutor) or similar cards for the same reason.
posts.html:
Saying that Yawgmoth's Will is better than Black Lotus is like saying candy is better than money.

The power 9 are the power 9 for a reason. That reason being that no matter what your combo, no matter what card you want to get to win these will help you.

Yawgmoth's Will is a great card, don't get me wrong. But it is not as universally awesome as the power 9. Black Lotus is the king of them all because it goes in any deck as said above. Of course if you have a Time Walk you might load up whatever mono-deck you have with dual lands just so you can slap it in there anyway, but that's a different discussion...

The only reasonable arguement anyone could make would be Demonic Tutor or similar cards for the same reason.

posts.post_content:
Variation 1  
T1 Black Lotus, Swamp, [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator).  
Opponent  
T1 Plains, [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares).  
  
Variation 2  
T1 Swamp, [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual), [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter).  
Opponent   
T1 Plains, [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares).  
  
  
In both situations your out in a card disadvantage. Black Lotus is not broken in any deck... Its beyond broken when you combine with card draw. Decks that only topdeck, it can actually lead to a card disadvantage.
